result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 22.

Matter before the Court for Arraignment.  Defense filed request for substitution on 8-19-15.  The Court finds that there is no issue as to substitution due to co-defendant case being resolved (guilty plea entered on today). The Court grants request for substitution.  Parties are advised that pursuant to current Clerk of Circuit Court rules this case is reassigned to Judge Timothy Witkowiak, Br. 22.  Branch 22 notified and available to hear this matter forthwith.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Officer Michael Driscoll.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.

Discussion with the Court and the parties - co-defendant has filed a request for substitution as to Case# 15CF002201 which was denied.  Original Information received and filed.
Arraignment NOT held.

Request For Substitution Of Judge received and filed as to this case - Court did not rule as to the Request for Substitution.
Parties request adjournment for arraignment to allow the trial court to rule as to the Request for Substitution filed on this case.
Case adjourned for arraignment and scheduling conference in Branch 44.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jerome Jay Johnson in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Jerome Jay Johnson in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Motion to dismiss by defense FOR LACK OF PROBABLE CAUSE argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
